page.title: 03WILTON DEAN
page.content:
Wilton Dean is a small village on the outskirts of Hawick. It is a quiet peaceful place, with 177 inhabitants.
The former school had two small rooms, heated by coal fires. The children worked on slates. Fo some of their work they went on Nature Walks. In the summer holidays , the school was used by the adults for dancing and bowling.
Wilton Dean had no water supply other than a well. Outside the houses were gas lamps, attended by a man every night and morning. In the mornings he would wake people for work.
The adults looked on all the children in the community as members of one big family.
